intro: Adonis multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered adonis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb with a short, thick rhizome and produces clusters of bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers in early spring. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it a hardy plant in temperate climates. Adonis multiflora is also noted for its medicinal properties, historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
